heroIntro: Welcome to your family's next chapter in San Juan de los Terreros. This 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom villa offers the perfect blend of modern living space and practical family comfort, priced at €479,000—that's 14% below the local average of €2,200/m². With 253m² of built space across a 219m² plot, you'll have room for children to play, work-from-home offices, and family gatherings. Located in a safe, established residential area with excellent access to international schools, healthcare facilities, and some of Spain's finest Blue Flag beaches, this property represents outstanding value in a thriving expat community. The Costa Blanca market is growing at 8% year-on-year, making this villa not just a family home but a sensible investment. Whether you're relocating from the UK, Northern Europe, or elsewhere, San Juan de los Terreros provides the perfect Mediterranean lifestyle without the premium price tag of more famous coastal hotspots.
areaSection: San Juan de los Terreros is a charming coastal town in Almería, approximately 45 minutes south of Alicante airport and nestled along the Mar de Pulpí coastline. This relatively undiscovered gem combines the best of authentic Spanish coastal living with modern convenience. The town benefits from a year-round mild Mediterranean climate—with average temperatures of 18°C in winter and 26°C in summer—making outdoor activities possible throughout the year. Unlike overcrowded tourist hotspots, San Juan de los Terreros maintains its character as a working fishing village mixed with residential development, offering genuine local culture alongside contemporary amenities. The beaches here are clean and maintained to Blue Flag standards, and the town is surrounded by dramatic cliffs and natural beauty that provide a stunning backdrop to daily life. With a population that includes a significant international community, the area has evolved to meet the needs of British, German, and Scandinavian residents while remaining authentically Spanish.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in San Juan de los Terreros revolves around the beach, local restaurants, and a tight-knit community of expatriates and Spanish families. The established international presence means English is widely spoken in shops, restaurants, and at schools, easing the transition for British families. Mornings might begin with a café con leche at a beachfront bar, lunch often involves fresh seafood from local restaurants, and weekends bring outdoor activities—kayaking, hiking the nearby cliffs, or exploring regional markets. The town has excellent supermarkets including Mercadona, Lidl, and Consum, plus a vibrant weekly market for fresh produce and local goods. For families, the slower pace compared to major cities like Alicante or Málaga means less traffic stress, safer neighborhoods, and more time for what matters. The expat community is well-established, offering everything from international schools to sports clubs and social groups. Healthcare access is comprehensive, with private clinics offering English-speaking doctors and a regional hospital 30 minutes away. This is a place where you genuinely live, rather than constantly visit.
investmentSection: Beyond being an exceptional family home, this villa represents a solid investment opportunity. The Costa Blanca property market is experiencing 8% year-on-year growth, with San Juan de los Terreros particularly attractive to European buyers seeking authentic Mediterranean living at reasonable prices. At €1,893/m², you're purchasing 40% below island market prices (Canaries, Balearics) while accessing the same quality of life. The rental potential is substantial—similar properties in this area command €800-€1,000 per week during peak season, translating to €35,000+ annually for 6 months of letting. Many families split their ownership, renting during summer months to offset costs. The town's growing popularity among remote workers and retirees suggests continued appreciation. With mortgage interest rates now more favorable for international buyers, and the Spanish government actively encouraging property investment, this villa offers both lifestyle benefits and financial appreciation potential.
conclusion: This 3-bedroom villa in San Juan de los Terreros represents more than just a property purchase—it's an investment in a family lifestyle that balances Mediterranean beauty with practical, modern living. At €479,000, priced 14% below the local average, you're acquiring genuine value in a region experiencing sustained market growth. The combination of excellent schools, family-friendly neighborhoods, Blue Flag beaches, and affordable cost of living makes this an compelling choice for families relocating from the UK or Northern Europe. The established expat community ensures you won't feel like outsiders, while the local Spanish character keeps the area authentic and vibrant. Whether this becomes your primary home, a vacation escape, or a rental investment property, San Juan de los Terreros offers flexibility that premium coastal markets cannot. Ready to explore this opportunity further? Contact our team via WhatsApp for a video tour, additional information, or to arrange a viewing. Your family's Mediterranean adventure awaits.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in the region meets high European standards, with options ranging from modern private clinics to the comprehensive regional hospital in Almería city. English-speaking doctors are readily available, and many medical professionals have experience serving the international community. Dental care, optometry, and specialist services are easily accessible. Prescription medications are affordable, and the Spanish healthcare system is recognized as one of Europe's best. For families, pediatric care is well-established, with English-speaking pediatricians available. Emergency services are responsive, and air ambulance access to larger hospitals in Alicante is available if needed.

faqs.answer: €479,000. This 3-bedroom villa is priced 14% below the San Juan de los Terreros market average of €2,200/m², representing significant value. Payment options can be discussed with our sales team, and EU citizens can typically access Spanish mortgage financing at competitive rates.

faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU and EU citizens can purchase property in Spain with minimal restrictions. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), and while the process requires legal documentation, it's straightforward with proper representation. British citizens, in particular, have been purchasing Spanish property for decades with no complications.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect additional costs: 6-8% transfer tax (depending on region), 1-2% notary and registration fees, and 300-600€ for property survey. Annual property tax (IBI) for this villa is approximately 120-180€. Having a clear understanding of total costs from the outset helps families budget accurately.

faqs.question: Является ли Коста-Бланка хорошим местом для покупки недвижимости?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca remains one of Spain's most attractive property markets for international families. The region offers established infrastructure, international schools, modern healthcare, and a 40% price advantage compared to island markets. The 8% year-on-year growth suggests continued appreciation, making it both a lifestyle and investment choice.

faqs.question: Какова стоимость жизни на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in San Juan de los Terreros is approximately 20-30% lower than the UK. Groceries, utilities, fuel, and dining out are all significantly cheaper. For a family, monthly expenses including utilities, groceries, and schooling might range from €1,500-€2,500 depending on lifestyle, compared to £2,500-£4,000+ in equivalent UK locations.

faqs.question: Как далеко Коста-Бланка от России?
faqs.answer: Approximately 1,400 km or 2.5 flight hours from London. Alicante-Elche airport (45 minutes from San Juan de los Terreros) has multiple daily direct flights to UK airports including London, Birmingham, Manchester, and Bristol. Flight costs are competitive, making regular UK visits feasible.

faqs.question: Какая погода на Коста-Бланке?
faqs.answer: San Juan de los Terreros enjoys a Mediterranean climate with mild winters (average 18°C) and warm summers (26°C). Sunshine averages 300+ days annually. Rainfall is minimal, primarily November-February. This climate supports outdoor living year-round, which is ideal for families seeking an active lifestyle.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain as a foreigner?
faqs.answer: EU citizens need no visa for Spain. Non-EU buyers can purchase property but may need to apply for residency if planning to stay longer than 90 days. The Spanish government offers several residency options including investor visas, and many families use the property purchase as a pathway to residency. Legal advice is recommended based on your nationality.

faqs.question: Могу ли я получить ипотеку в Испании как иностранец?
faqs.answer: Yes. Most Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically up to 80% of property value. Interest rates for international buyers are currently competitive (3-4.5%). You'll need a Spanish tax number (NIE), proof of income, and typically a larger deposit (20%) than EU citizens. British and Northern European buyers represent a significant mortgage market in Spain.

faqs.question: Is this villa suitable for a family with young children?
faqs.answer: Ideal. The 3-bedroom layout provides separate bedrooms for parents and children, plus room for a home office or guest space. The 253m² built area offers ample living room, the neighborhood is secure with low traffic, and Blue Flag beaches are 20 minutes away for family swimming. International schools with English curriculum are 10-15 minutes distant, and English-speaking pediatric care is readily available.
